Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: check constraint value that is used to maintain therelationship between SUPPORT FACILITY and its various sub-types.
Column Comment.1: VESSEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the marine vessel.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC VESSEL CONFIGURATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifierfor this configuration of the seismic vessel.
Column Comment.3: ACQUISITION DESIGN ID: Unique identifier for the acquisition design
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: FATHOMETER AZIMUTH: the azimuth bearing from the point of reference to thefathometer attachment on the vessel.
Column Comment.8: ANTENNA TO FATHOMETER OFFSET; the offset distance from the antenna to thefathometer.
Column Comment.9: MASTER VESSEL INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating whether this vessel is a mastervessel, controlling seismic operations.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REFERENCE POINT: The point to which the offsets are referenced. In many cases,this is the primary antenna, but in some cases other positions on the vessel are usedas the reference point.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ANTENNA SHOT OFFSET: Offset distance from the primary antenna to the center ofthe shot array.
Column Comment.15: SLAVE VESSEL INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this vessel is a slave vessel,receiving its operating instructions from another vessel.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: ANTENNA STREAMER OFFSET: the offset distance from the primary antenna to thefar end of the streamer array.
Column Comment.18: ANTENNA STREAMER OFFSET: the offset distance from the primary antenna to thenear end of the streamer array.
Column Comment.19: VESSEL AZIMUTH: The bearing of the vessel during recording of this acquisitiondesign.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
